title: Contributing to psychds
text: find bug, please open issue : clear, descriptive title Steps reproduce issue Expected vs.Â actual behavior environment (R version, OS, package versions) relevant error messages screenshots Use check_psychds_deps(detailed = TRUE) get environment information.

title: Contributing to psychds
text: Feature requests welcome! Please open issue : clear description feature useful examples mockups (applicable) Read package documentation Check existing issues Ask questions discussions

title: Creating Data Dictionaries
text: data dictionary document describes variables dataset. serves essential documentation : - Remember variables mean months later Collaborators - Help others understand data Reproducibility - Enable others reuse data correctly Compliance - Meet requirements data sharing mandates

title: Creating Data Dictionaries
text: easiest way create data dictionary psychds Shiny app: Navigate â€œUpdate Data Dictionaryâ€ sidebar.

title: Creating Data Dictionaries
text: Load dataset - Select Psych-DS dataset folder Edit variable - Add descriptions, types, constraints Define categorical values - Document allowed values meanings Set missing value codes - Define missing data coded Generate dictionary - Save metadata export HTML See Shiny App Guide detailed instructions.

title: Creating Data Dictionaries
text: HTML output features: Professional, modern styling Table contents navigation Print-optimized CSS save PDF, open HTML file browser press Ctrl+P (Cmd+P Mac).

text: âŒ Bad: â€œageâ€ âœ… Good: â€œParticipant age years time initial assessmentâ€ âŒ Bad: â€œrtâ€ âœ… Good: â€œMean response time milliseconds across correct trials Stroop taskâ€

title: Creating Data Dictionaries
text: data dictionary complements dataset_description.json metadata. dataset_description.json contains machine-readable metadata, data dictionary provides human-readable documentation. included Psych-DS dataset:
code: my_dataset/ â”œâ”€â”€ dataset_description.json    # Machine-readable â”œâ”€â”€ data_dictionary.html        # Human-readable â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ data/     â””â”€â”€ study-exp1_data.csv

title: Getting Started with psychds
text: psychds package helps researchers organize psychological behavioral research data according Psych-DS standard. vignette walk : Installing package Checking dependencies Launching Shiny app Understanding Psych-DS structure

title: Getting Started with psychds
Getting Started with psychds
Getting Started with psychds
text: using psychds, verify dependencies properly installed: detailed check show: Installed package versions R environment information PDF generation capabilities (optional)
code: library(psychds)  # Basic check check_psychds_deps()  # Detailed check with version information check_psychds_deps(detailed = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with psychds
text: primary interface psychds interactive Shiny application: opens browser window dataset builder wizard.

title: Getting Started with psychds
code: # Force external browser (useful if RStudio viewer has issues) run_psych_ds_app(force_browser = TRUE)  # Use a specific port run_psych_ds_app(port = 3838)  # Minimal dependency checking for faster startup run_psych_ds_app(startup_mode = "minimal")

title: Getting Started with psychds
text: Psych-DS compliant dataset following structure:
code: my_dataset/ â”œâ”€â”€ dataset_description.json    # Required: Dataset metadata â”œâ”€â”€ README.md                   # Recommended: Human-readable description â”œâ”€â”€ data/                       # Required: Contains data files â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ study-exp1_data.csv â”‚   â””â”€â”€ study-exp1_data.json    # Sidecar with variable metadata â”œâ”€â”€ analysis/                   # Optional â”œâ”€â”€ materials/                  # Optional â””â”€â”€ results/                    # Optional

title: Getting Started with psychds
text: JSON file contains metadata dataset using Schema.org vocabulary:
code: {   "@context": "https://schema.org/",   "@type": "Dataset",   "name": "Visual Attention Experiment 2024",   "description": "A study examining visual attention in adults",   "author": [     {       "@type": "Person",       "givenName": "Jane",       "familyName": "Smith"     }   ],   "variableMeasured": [     {       "@type": "PropertyValue",       "name": "participant_id",       "description": "Unique participant identifier"     }   ] }

title: Getting Started with psychds
text: Psych-DS uses keyword-based filenames describe data files: Example: study-attention_session-1_task-stroop_data.csv

title: Getting Started with psychds

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: psychds Shiny application provides guided, step--step interface creating Psych-DS compliant datasets. guide walks section application.

title: Using the Shiny Application
Using the Shiny Application
text: app four main sections accessible sidebar: Create Dataset - Build new Psych-DS dataset Update Data Dictionary - Edit variable definitions Validate Dataset - Check compliance standard Upload OSF - Publish Open Science Framework

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: dataset creation wizard three steps:

what: Step 1: Project Directory and Data Files
title: Using the Shiny Application
text: step, : Select project directory - folder containing research materials. building new dataset using files select directory. Choose data files - Browse select CSV files include. Click files/directories select/deselect . Configure optional directories - Choose additional folders create: analysis/ - Analysis scripts pipelines materials/ - Study materials (stimuli, protocols, flyers) results/ - Output figures tables products/ - Papers, presentations documentation/ - Additional documentation original files safe! app reads existing files create standardized copies. original data never modified.

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Enter information dataset: Required fields: Name - descriptive name dataset Description - Brief description data contains Author information: Add authors names optional ORCID iDs Click â€œAdd New Authorâ€ add multiple authors Detected Variables: app automatically detects column names CSV files. Variables name across files assumed identical definitions.

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Rename data files using Psych-DS naming conventions: Select files - Check boxes select multiple files batch operations Configure keywords - file, set values standard keywords: study, session, subject, task, etc. Auto-Name Data - Automatically fill keyword values constant columns data (instance, file contains column like â€œsubject_idâ€ value every row, can use column name file) Preview - See new filename configure keywords Example transformation:

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Step 3, â€™ll prompted : Choose name dataset folder Select save Review file structure preview Click â€œCreate Datasetâ€ generate Psych-DS compliant dataset

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: data dictionary editor allows document variables dataset.

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Click â€œLoad Datasetâ€ Navigate Psych-DS dataset folder app detect CSV files extract variable names

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Select variable list edit properties: Basic Properties: Description - variable represents Data Type - string, integer, number, boolean, date, etc. Unit - Measurement unit (applicable) Constraints: Required - Whether variable must value Unique - Whether values must unique Min/Max - Valid range numeric variables Pattern - Regex pattern string validation Categorical Values: variables fixed set allowed values: Click â€œAdd Valueâ€ Enter value, label, description Repeat categories Example â€œconditionâ€ variable: | Value | Label | Description | |â€”â€”-|â€”â€”-|â€”â€”â€”â€”-| | control | Control Group | intervention | | treatment | Treatment Group | Received intervention |

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Define codes represent missing values across variables: Common codes: NA, N/, -999, ., null Add custom codes specific data

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Click â€œGenerate Human-Readable Dictionaryâ€ create formatted HTML document: Choose whether include missing value codes Click â€œGenerate Dictionaryâ€ HTML file saved dataset folder can : - Opened web browser - Printed PDF using Ctrl+P / Cmd+P - Shared collaborators

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Check dataset Psych-DS specification:

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Select dataset directory Click â€œValidateâ€ Review results

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: validator checks: âœ… Required files present (dataset_description.json) âœ… Valid JSON syntax structure âœ… Required metadata fields populated âœ… Data files correct location âœ… Filename conventions followed âœ… Schema.org vocabulary used correctly

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Results shown checklist : Pass (green) - Check passed Fail (red) - Issue found must fixed Click item see details suggestions fixing issues.

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Publish validated dataset Open Science Framework:

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Go osf.io/settings/tokens Generate Personal Access Token appropriate permissions Paste token app Click â€œTest Connectionâ€ verify

title: Using the Shiny Application
text: Browse validated Psych-DS dataset Click â€œVerify Datasetâ€ confirm â€™s ready upload

text: Destination: - Create new OSF project - Add existing project Configuration: - Preserve folder structure (recommended) - Auto-generate README file - Set folder path OSF

title: psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
text: psychds provides tools creating, editing, validating psychological research datasets following Psych-DS standard. package includes: interactive Shiny application building Psych-DS compliant datasets existing directories Functions validating existing datasets standard Tools generating data dictionaries professional formatting OSF integration publishing validated datasets

title: psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
text: easiest way use psychds interactive Shiny app: opens guided interface : Selecting project directory data files Adding dataset metadata (name, description, authors) Standardizing filenames Psych-DS keywords Generating data dictionaries Validating dataset Exploring dataset Optionally uploading OSF

text: Upload validated datasets directly Open Science Framework: Authenticate personal access token Create new projects add existing ones Preserve folder structure Auto-generate README files

title: psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
text: Psych-DS (Psychological Dataset Standard) provides specification organizing behavioral psychological research data. Key components include: dataset_description.json: Metadata dataset using Schema.org vocabulary data/: Directory containing data files standardized names Keyword-based filenames: e.g., study-attention_session-1_data.csv Data dictionaries: Documentation variables Learn psych-ds.github.io

title: psychds - Build and Validate Psych-DS Datasets
text: R >= 4.0.0 Required packages: shiny, shinydashboard, shinyjs, shinyFiles, DT, jsonlite Optional: sortable, zip, pointblank (full functionality)

what: Check and Load Package Dependencies â€” check_dependencies
title: Check and Load Package Dependencies â€” check_dependencies
text: function provides robust package management following CRAN policies. checks versions, handles conflicts, provides clear user feedback.

title: Check and Load Package Dependencies â€” check_dependencies
code: check_dependencies(   min_versions = NULL,   recommended_versions = NULL,   startup_mode = getOption("psychds.startup_mode", "recommended") )

title: Check and Load Package Dependencies â€” check_dependencies
text: min_versions Named list minimum required package versions recommended_versions Named list recommended package versions startup_mode Character: "strict", "recommended", "minimal"

title: Check and Load Package Dependencies â€” check_dependencies
text: Logical indicating success

title: Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
text: Verifies required optional package dependencies installed meet minimum version requirements.

title: Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
text: detailed Logical. TRUE, displays detailed information installed package versions, R environment, PDF generation capabilities. Default FALSE. check_pdf Logical. TRUE (detailed = TRUE), also checks PDF generation capabilities. Default TRUE.

title: Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
text: Invisibly returns TRUE required dependencies satisfied, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
text: function checks : Required packages: shiny, shinydashboard, shinyjs, shinyFiles, DT, jsonlite Optional packages: sortable, zip, pointblank, osfr Minimum version requirements package PDF generation capabilities (rmarkdown, TinyTeX, pagedown) dependencies missing, function provides installation instructions.

title: Check psychds Dependencies â€” check_psychds_deps
code: # Quick check check_psychds_deps() #> Checking psychds dependencies... #> âœ“ shiny (1.11.1) #> âœ“ shinydashboard (0.7.3) #> âœ“ shinyjs (2.1.0) #> âœ“ shinyFiles (0.9.3) #> âœ“ DT (0.34.0) #> âœ“ jsonlite (2.0.0) #> âœ“ jsonvalidate (1.5.0) #> âœ“ dplyr (1.1.4) #> âœ“ tidyr (1.3.1) #> âœ“ readr (2.1.6) #>  #> Recommended packages: #> âœ“ httr (1.4.7) #> âœ“ rmarkdown (2.30) #> âœ“ knitr (1.50) #>  #> PDF Generation: #> â—‹ No PDF generation available #>   Run setup_pdf_generation() to enable #>  #> âœ“ All required dependencies are installed!  # Detailed check with all version info check_psychds_deps(detailed = TRUE) #> Error in check_psychds_deps(detailed = TRUE): unused argument (detailed = TRUE)

what: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
text: Launches interactive Shiny application creating, editing, validating Psych-DS compliant datasets.

title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
code: run_psych_ds_app(   launch.browser = getOption("shiny.launch.browser", interactive()),   port = getOption("shiny.port"),   host = getOption("shiny.host", "127.0.0.1"),   startup_mode = getOption("psychds.startup_mode", "recommended"),   force_browser = getOption("psychds.force_browser", FALSE),   ... )

title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
text: launch.browser Logical function. app opened browser? Defaults TRUE interactive sessions. port Integer. Port number application. NULL, random available port used. host Character. Host IP address. Defaults "127.0.0.1" (localhost). startup_mode Character. One "strict", "recommended", "minimal". Controls dependency checking strictness: "strict": Requires packages minimum versions "recommended": Warns outdated packages continues "minimal": checks critical dependencies force_browser Logical. Force opening external browser. Recommended RStudio users experiencing viewer issues. ... Additional arguments passed shiny::runApp().

title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
text: function return value. launches Shiny application blocks app closed.

title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
text: application provides guided interface : Selecting project directories data files Adding dataset metadata Standardizing filenames Psych-DS keywords Generating data dictionaries Validating datasets Psych-DS specification Uploading Open Science Framework (OSF)

title: Run the Psych-DS Shiny Application â€” run_psych_ds_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Standard launch run_psych_ds_app()  # Force external browser (if RStudio viewer has issues) run_psych_ds_app(force_browser = TRUE)  # Minimal checking for faster startup run_psych_ds_app(startup_mode = "minimal")  # Specific port run_psych_ds_app(port = 3838) } # }

what: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
title: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
text: Interactive function help users set PDF generation Interactive setup wizard enabling PDF generation psychds. Guides users installing TinyTeX pagedown.

title: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
text: force Logical. TRUE, runs setup even PDF generation already available. Default FALSE.

title: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
text: Invisibly returns TRUE PDF generation successfully configured, FALSE otherwise.

title: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
text: PDF generation requires either: TinyTeX (recommended): lightweight LaTeX distribution pagedown: alternative uses Chrome/Chromium neither available, data dictionaries generated HTML files can printed PDF web browser.

title: Setup PDF Generation Capabilities â€” setup_pdf_generation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run interactive setup setup_pdf_generation()  # Force re-setup even if already configured setup_pdf_generation(force = TRUE) } # }
